Reviews.Title: “Perfect overnight”
Reviews.Author: gulietta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 separate rooms. And the experience was day and night. The kids got the noisy room and no peace was to be had at all. One has to keep the window open to be able to breathe. We paid the Euro6 extra to get aircon in our room, so we could keep windows closed besides our room was at the back of the building. We had a very comfortable night. It is small but, well situated. Stairs are wide and easy to negotiate. We had a vehicle and parking was easy and close in spite of the one ways. I would not like to spend a extended holiday here, but is was absolutely perfect for our need of one night in Madrid before heading out to explore the rest of Spain.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: molo14
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Tijcal II for 3 nights and was very satisfied. The (solo) room was small but compact and comfortable, had a large closet, desk, free wifi, and ensuite bathroom&shower. It was very clean, and there was a maid service every day. The location - right in the center of the city - is incredible, and despite that - my room faced an inner courtyard and so it was very quiet. The only drawback is the additional cost for AC - for me, it was necessary. The price is still extremely reasonable though, the service was fine, I didn't try the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Crisiuli
Reviews.Content: It's a very clean place, the maids tidied up the room each day, free wi-fi in room, nice people, the best thing about was that, although being in the centre of the city, very close to plaza del sol, there was no noise whatsoever from the outside, so we had very restful nights. The bathroom was a little cramped but great value for the money, we would recommend it as a great finding.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: somelammer567
Reviews.Content: I checked TripAdvisor after booking and got a shock, but after staying here, this place has gotten a bad rap on here for noise and bad service, but I experienced neither. I would rate it a good choice for couples or friends on city breaks to Madrid. Although it looks a bit seedy from the outside, it's well-lit, and very clean and comfortable on the inside. The rooms are tastefully decorated and spotless, if a little Spartan and small. The bed was comfortable if a little hard. The windows were heavily soundproofed, so we got a good night's sleep -- and just as well, since the street is very close to Puerta del Sol and thus very noisy. Do be aware however, that just about everything is an optional extra, including air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, all basics in place, noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: travelchamp
Reviews.Content: Location: We stayed in Hostal Tijal II for its location. Its right in the centre of Puerta del Sol, the heart of the city, near to Metro stop Sol. Surrounded by tons of eateries, bars, cafes and of course all attractions are walking distance away. Facilities: The room was quite small. Our twin bed room had 2 beds in a single line, so you can imagine the width of the room. The bathroom esp the shower cubicle was very small, but functional. Housekeeping was done daily and hotel was generally clean. You could borrow an iron if you need. Food: There is no room service but they have a Tijcal restaurant down on the street where you get a discount as a guest. Serves great pizzas. Anyhow, the street is lined with numerous cafes, so no problem. You can order breakfast (juice, coffee, crossiants) the night before and they will serve you in your room in the morning. Very reasonably priced. Also, there is a coffee vending machine at the reception. Downside: Its near a club. As Madrid parties all night, you can hear the vibrations of music in your room till wee hours and can have a sleepless night if you are a light sleeper. The club is closed on Sunday, so it is pretty peaceful on Sunday. Wouldn't mind going back for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: moglin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellently located - very central in Madrid. It is on a busy street, but we had no problems with noise as we were facing in - yes we had a view of someone elses room, but this was not a problem as they tended to keep the curtains closed! For the price - just over 40 Euros per night when we stayed - this hotel was good. Very clean and room was cleaned lovely every day. Yes the room was small but big enough for 2 (we had a double) spending most of the day out anyway! There was a little bit of building noise but as long as the window was shut we could not hear it and it didn't seem to start till about half past nine in the morning anyway. The staff were fine, not overly friendly, but not rude either. I would recommend this hotel to people on a budget who are interested in exploring Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Nell2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the old city centre. It is a hostal, so don't expect too much. Rooms are basic and clean. Rooms are equipped with airco; you have to pay an additional sum for the use thereof.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option”
Reviews.Author: bobwire
Reviews.Content: Central location. Service was efficient, rooms were clean and noise was minimal. Unfortunately the hotel had forgotten to reserve one of the two single rooms booked. However, they found alternative accomodation for the first night within the same block immediately - then within the hotel for the remainder of the stay. Given the budget price, I couldn't have expected more from this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Building site!!!!”
Reviews.Author: WirralKitten
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location with clean rooms - small but at this price expected. However, that is where my good comments end. This was a building site. There was half the floor dug up as soon as you set foot inside, with little or no boarding to attempt to make it safe, then rooms were still being built right next door to ours. The noise & dust was horrible. Also, the staff could do with some lessons in manners as they were very rude. They seemed to look for ways to argue with you & tried to charge us for things already paid for (breakfast was paid for but did not arrive & we were later told this was our fault even though we ordered it!) Also charge 5Euro per day for aircon which is not mentioned when booking & was also not available for most rooms due to the building work - they said they could not turn the electricity on as a result it was hot hot hot in those rooms! We eventually did get air-con but I know most rooms were still without it. Also, our friends were accused of flooding the hotel when they took a shower - the shower was not plumbed in properly by the look of it, but this was their fault apparently! All I can conclude is that this will be a clean travel-lodge style place in a good location once they finish building & staff have some lessons in customer relations.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cosy rooms”
Reviews.Author: hea27
Reviews.Content: Location: great for Sol Metro station, theatre, shops and main attractions Reception: quick and easy Room: small but clean Breakfast: didn’t purchase (3EUR p/p delivered to room)

Reviews.Title: “Good value in central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Tara38
Reviews.Content: This is a prime location in Madrid- I feel lucky that we found it. Great price. The rooms are even more tiny than usual European rooms. We were not traveling to spend a lot of time in our room, we just needed a great, centrally located place to sleep, and it worked out great. It was very clean, A/C worked great (I think we had to pay 5Euro for this), and it was very secure. Lots of great tapas places around, including "Abuelos" just down the street. There is a great place for churros in the morning just down the street to the right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Pharang
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here in June 06 for 4 nights (before taking the overnight train to Barcelona). The hotel is located about 300m from Puerta Del Sol. It was clean and tidy. The room was small, as was the ensuite bathroom but perfect for you if all you want is somewhere to lay your head at night. We had fresh sheets and towels everyday, there is also a tv in the room with a couple of english channels. We were in the room right next to the reception desk - which i was initially a little concerned about due to noise - didn't hear a thing! You have to pay a little more for the airconditioning but it is worth it especially in the summer! Everything is a short distance from this hotel and there are lots of bars and restaurants on the doorstep if you don't fancy venturing to far from the hotel but the city itself had oudles of restaurants to go to. The day that we left they were more than happy with us leaving our bags at the hotel as we went for a final day of sight seeing before we caught our train. The staff speak english too and are very helpful recommending various attractions to see. You have to be buzzed into the building at night (and sometimes during the day), the hotel is on the 2nd floor, but there is a lift. There is a step to get in the building and once in the hotel another step to contend with so may not be ideal for those in wheel chairs

Reviews.Title: “Small and not really comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Chad_and_Ang
Reviews.Content: We don't really want to give this hotel a bad review, because the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and the location was good - but the main purpose of a hotel is to give you a good night's sleep, and the Tijcal II just didn't. The rooms (and hallways) were tiny, and we didn't sleep well any of the three nights we stayed - the bed just wasn't at all comfortable. The other problem was noise. The walls were thin enough to hear when someone else was talking (in reception and other rooms), and the doors slamming was like two pots hit together right by your ears. Still, if you can sleep practically anywhere, and you want to be in the thick of Madrid - this may be your place.

Reviews.Title: “Small but ok”
Reviews.Author: xenathedog
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the rooms at the end of the corridoor are tiny. I had to shuffle things around each day and again at night in order to get things out of the suitcase, which would only fit against the wardrobe next to the bed. A very tight squeeze and bathroom same story. Toilet jammed in right against the door - but then 162 Euros for 3 nights is ok for where it is. Don't bother with the breakfast, there is a great cafe right next door that has wonderful coffee and toast. On the third night I was moved up the corridoor to a much larger room with a window that opened out onto a 'garden' of plastic flowers - nice touch! There is a lift to help get bags upstairs, and the location is great - lots of great restaurants nearby. Overal pretty good value for money, although the size of the room does kind of take your breath away!

Reviews.Title: “Good but very small room”
Reviews.Author: Juangome
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean place, good service. However, the room was so small that it rather felt like a cell! To make matters worse, the room's window was extremelly small, could not be fully opened and faced a wall! At the end of our 5 day stay we were sofocated.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: AET
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and very clean. The only thing was that our room was very small, although we found it okay as we didn't spend much time there. We were in the very last room along a long corridor and from what we saw the rooms nearer reception seemed much larger. We walked everywhere from the hotel as it was so central. The staff were also very nice, in fact the man on reception called the spanish speaking booking line, for us, to arrange tickets for a Real Madrid football match!

HotelInfo.Name: Tijcal II Hostal Madrid
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Cruz 26, 28012 Madrid, Spain
